column4: hello :) i have a problem with LUKS LVM and ubuntu 9.10. i has installed a new ubuntu 9.10. after the installation i like to use my crypted LUKS/LVM partitions for home/$user. so i edit my cryptotab ( http://pastebin.com/f32ca6447 ) the fstab ( http://pastebin.com/f4e4968ee ) run update-initramfs -u -k all und reboot the system. after grub2 prompt the i have to enter the encrypt password. i wrote 3-5 signs (it isn't the complete password) and sys
for me to get it to work on my crypted /home on a 9.04 machine upgraded to 9.10, I have to boot with nosplash and without quiet, then I have to type it 2-3 times before it works.
basically, it's just broken, they broke it when they tried to make things boot faster.
i have disable splash and quiet. but is very hard to enter the the passphrase 3 times parallel the boot process output is printed :/
no better solutions to fix this?
well, I enter it when it's halting to ask for it. if I don't enter it fast enough (multiple times) I get dropped to recovery shell and have to cryptsetup luksOpen and mount from there
bad bug :D so i replace my system with the 9.04 backup and try ubuntu 9.10 later :D thx for your help
